channel.title: Some weird error?
channel.description:
Okay i'm trying to make my lastest script "Draynor Netter" but i keep getting this error:
[php] Line 130: [Warning] (15628:16): Calculation always evaluates to True in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\Draynor Netter.scar Line 139: [Warning] (15637:12): "and True" is not needed in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\Draynor Netter.scar [/php]
and the lines are:
[php] if (invfull) and Bank = True then [/php]
What does it mean? All i want it to do is see if the inv is full and see if Bank in the const is True.

item.title: Some weird error?
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

[quote=“junior, post:5, topic:31168”]N4th4n, he set it up as a const.
you can set it up in a const like ‘true’ or true. Doesnt really matter.
But a boolean from a function cant be placed in ‘’.
Correct me if im wrong.[/quote]

I’m sorry I didn’t see the “cant be placed in” I thought you said it could.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

arr0w:

k so that warnign doesnt really mean anything?

Run this in scar:

[scar]const
s = True;

var
gB : Boolean;

begin
gB := True;
if(s)and
gB = True then
Writeln(‘Warnings won’‘t stop the script’);
end.[/scar]

item.title: Some weird error?
item.dc:creator: @arr0w Arr0w
item.description:
@arr0w wrote:

[php]
program DraynorNetter;
{.include SRL/SRL.Scar}

const {SETUP}
//--------------------------------------------------|
HowManyLoads = 100; //How many loads were you thinking of doing?|
Bank = True; //Do you want to bank the fish you catch?|
Drop = False; //Do you want to drop the fish you catch?|
//--------------------------------------------------|
VNumber = ‘1.1’; //DONT TOUCH THIS PLEASE!|
StartingPlayer = 0; //Staring Player Number. |
//--------------------------------------------------|

procedure DeclarePlayers;
begin

NumberOfPlayers( HowManyPlayers );
CurrentPlayer := StartingPlayer;

Players[0].Name := ‘Arr0w’; //Username.
Players[0].Pass := ‘’; //Password.
Players[0].Nick := ‘r0w’; //3-4 Chars of the Username.
Players[0].Active := True; //Will this player be Active?
Players[0].Loc := ‘’; //Do NOT Touch.

Players[1].Name := ‘Arr0w’; //Username.
Players[1].Pass := ‘’; //Password.
Players[1].Nick := ‘r0w’; //3-4 Chars of the Username.
Players[1].Active := True; //Will this player be Active?
Players[1].Loc := ‘’; //Do NOT Touch.

Players[2].Name := ‘Arr0w’; //Username.
Players[2].Pass := ‘’; //Password.
Players[2].Nick := ‘r0w’; //3-4 Chars of the Username.
Players[2].Active := True; //Will this player be Active?
Players[2].Loc := ‘’; //Do NOT Touch.

WriteLn( IntToStr( HowManyPlayers ) + ’ Players’);
end;

procedure Face(Side:String);//Made by Wizzup?, thanks Wizzup?
var Fx, Fy, Dx, Dy : Integer;
var ComMark: Integer;

begin

MarkTime(ComMark);
case LowerCase(Side) of

‘n’ : begin Fx := 566; Fy := 13; end; ‘e’ : begin Fx := 573; Fy := 20; end; ‘s’ : begin Fx := 566; Fy := 27; end; ‘w’ : begin Fx := 560; Fy := 19; end; end;

KeyDown(VK_RIGHT);
repeat
Wait(1);
until ( (FindColor(Dx,Dy,723587,Fx,Fy,Fx,Fy)) or (TimeFromMark(ComMark) > 12000) );
KeyUp(VK_Right);
end;

procedure Write(Text : string);
begin
WriteLn(Text)
end;

procedure Stopped(why : string);
begin
Logout;
Write(’ Script stopped at: ’ + TheTime + ’ ‘)
Write(’ The Reason: ’ + Why + ’ ')
end;

procedure Loc(Location: string);
begin
Players[CurrentPlayer].loc := Location;
end;

procedure LogIn;
begin
If (loggedIn) = False then
LogInPlayer;
end;

procedure SetupScript;
begin
Gametab(4)
Wait(1000+Random(52));
Face(‘w’)
end;

Function FindBanSym : Boolean;
var
B, Rx, Ry : Integer;
begin
If FindSymbol(Rx, Ry, ‘Bank’) then
begin
Result := True;
end else
begin
Result := False;
B := B+1;
end;
repeat
FindBanSym;
Until( B = 20 ) or FindSymbol(Rx, Ry, ‘Bank’)
if ( B = 20 ) then
begin
Players[CurrentPlayer].Active := False;
LogOut;
Stopped(‘Because the script could’‘nt locate the bank symbol’)
end;
end;

procedure FindFishSpot;
begin
repeat
if (FindBanSym) = True then
Mouse(x -10+Random(2), y +10+Random(3), 1, 1, True)
Flag;
if (IsTextAt2(x, y, ‘ish’, 5) = True) then
Mouse(x, y, 2, 2, True)
Flag;
FindNormalRandoms;
until(invfull)
end;

procedure Dropal;
begin
if Drop = True or true then
GameTab(4)
DropTo(2, 28)
end;

procedure Tobank;
var
Rx, Ry : integer;
begin
if((invfull) and (Bank))then

if FindSymbol(Rx, Ry, ‘Bank’) then
Mmouse(x, y, 3, 3)
Wait(100+Random(105))
Mouse(x, y, 3, 3, True)
Flag;
[/php]

item.title: Some weird error?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

A warning will NOT stop your script running.

The warning your getting tells me you are using something like this: “if(hello = true)then”. If you use something like “if(hello)then” it will automatically check to see if the boolean is true, thus no need for = true.

Try using:

if((invfull) and (Bank))then

Read full topic

item.title: Some weird error?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Nathan…he’s right. Hes just checking to see if arrow didn’t accidentallly set it as a string.

And guys, next time, if you need help, post every bit of info you have, especially if you want the answer fast.

Read full topic

item.title: Some weird error?
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

It wouldn’t be a boolean then, it would be a string in the const

[php]
program New;
const
blah = ‘True’;
begin
if(blah) then
Writeln(‘blah’);
end.
[/php]

Won’t work but

[php]program New;
const
blah = True;
begin
if(blah) then
Writeln(‘blah’);
end.
[/php]

does.

Read full topic

I think its just the way you have your if statement set up, try this:

[SCAR]if ((invfull) and (Bank = true)) then[/SCAR]

item.title: Some weird error?
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Okay.
how is it set up in the Const? Like this?
[scar]Bank=‘True’;[/scar]

Because if it is, it will need to be like this
[scar]
If (InvFull) And
Bank = ‘True’ Then
[/scar]

If that doesnt work Try this
[scar]
If (InvFull) Then
If(Bank=‘True’ or True;)Then
Begin
// procedure here
End Else
If(Bank=‘False’ or False;)Then
Begin
//procedure here
End; //something like that you know what im saying.
[/scar]

Or Try this

[scar]
Procedure BankCheck;
Begin
Case Bank of
‘True’ or True: //procedure here.
‘False’ or False://procedure here
End;
End;

If (InvFull) Then
BankCheck;
[/scar]

Im not sure if thats going to work. Sorry if I didnt help

Read full topic
